Dear Participant,
We invite you to share your valuable insights on epidemic forecasting during the COVID-19 pandemic in this brief 10-minute survey.
Our goal is to bridge the gap between epidemic forecasts and practical decision-making, especially in resource-constrained settings. Your experiences will help us:

column2: Identify unmet needs related to epidemic forecasting.
Develop user-friendly tools to evaluate and interpret forecasts for policymakers.

column1: This survey is divided into five sections:

column2: Participant Information: To confirm your eligibility for this research.
Metrics: To understand what types of epidemic forecasts were most commonly used in public health decision-making.
Questions: To identify the key policy questions and decisions that epidemic forecasts helped address.
Evaluation: To learn how epidemic forecasts were evaluated (if at all).
Barriers: To uncover the main challenges that hindered the use and usefulness of epidemic forecasts for policymakers.
